articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Coronavirus dents movie box offices in China
articles.description: Ticket sales to Disney's "Mulan," which is set in China and is expected to hit theaters there in March, could suffer.
articles.content:
The effects of the deadly coronavirus are hitting China's box office hard as shuttered theaters force studios to delay and even cancel Chinese movie premieres that were scheduled over the all-important Lunar New Year holiday season.

articles.title: UPS and pilots to make China flights voluntary
articles.description: Accord between labor group and shipping giant comes in response to pilot safety concerns over the deadly coronavirus.
articles.content:

articles.title: China urged to shut down wild animal markets amid coronavirus
articles.description: "It is hard to design more perfect conditions for new viruses to emerge than market systems such as that in Wuhan," the Wildlife Conservation Society​ said.

articles.title: Baby tests positive for coronavirus 30 hours after birth
articles.description: The mother tested positive for coronavirus when she was pregnant, said doctors in Wuhan, China.
articles.content:
The coronavirus has infected at least 24,000 people worldwide, and officials in China now say the youngest person with the illness is a newborn baby who was infected just 30 hours after being born.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Faceboook fights spread of coronavirus misinformation
articles.description: As health officials struggle to contain the coronavirus outbreak, Facebook is fighting the spread of misinformation about the disease online. AP reporter David Klepper joined CBSN to discuss the social media platform's efforts.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: United, American suspend Hong Kong flights as demand drops
articles.description: The airlines said they're suspending flights to Hong Kong because of weak demand as the coronavirus spreads.
articles.content:
American Airlines said Tuesday it has suspended flights to Hong Kong through Feb. 20 due to weak demand, and United Airlines will do the same next weekend.
